metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20430 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
GNU Libextractor through 1.8 has an out-of-bounds read vulnerability in the function history_extract() in plugins/ole2_extractor.c, related to EXTRACTOR_common_convert_to_utf8 in common/convert.c. It was discovered that Libextractor incorrectly handled certain specially crafted files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-20430` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

extract - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-archive - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-av - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-exiv2 - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-flac - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-gif - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-gstreamer - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-html - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-jpeg - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-midi - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-mpeg - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-ogg - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-ole2 - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-pdf - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-rpm - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-thumbnailgtk - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugin-tiff - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugins-all - 1:1.9-2
libextractor-plugins-misc - 1:1.9-2
libextractor3 - 1:1.9-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libextractor package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.9-2').
